column4: plus i dont wanna move the files or redownload when i reformat
i used pysdm to mount it on boot
i just did chmod 700 /dev/sda2 and now i cant make a folder
is there a way to fix that?
the default permissions for /dev/sda was probably 660, revert that
do 'mount' and see what /dev/sda2 is mounted to; that's the folder you want to mess with; for example /media/Download
now in that folder make a new folder that is going to be your user folder, so "sudo mkdir /media/sda2/Downloads" then own it by "sudo chown -R MgMt /media/sda2/Downloads
mount again, then try to "mkdir /media/sda2/Downloads/test" (without sudo!)
yay! you've experienced one of linux' good old permissions annoyances
